title: Hextech Crafting thread!
body:
http://oce.leagueoflegends.com/sites/default/files/styles/scale_xlarge/public/upload/hextech_crafting_banner_1_0.jpg?itok=khrZf9mN

Hey everyone,

Seeing a lot of posts about Hextech Crafting, hope you guys are enjoying it!

If you have any questions of just want to talk about what you got please post it in here.

Before you post your questions though make sure you check out this post which has a lot of information around how it all works - http://oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/site/2016-season-update/champion-mastery.html

A lot more info can also be found on our player support page - https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/207884233-Hextech-Crafting-Guide

replies.body: Not a fan of having an RNG mechanic tied to potentially 20-40+ minute games. There needs to be some sort of odd enhancement tied to performance and game duration. Kinda bs that it's as binary as "Did you lose? No shards for you. Did you win? Okay, now you get a 1 in 10 chance at a Key Shard (or whatever the RNG value is for Key Shard drops). Regardless of if it was a close 50 minute, super-close, well-deserved win or a 20 minute stomp or if you got a D or an S+"

Hey man,

Try to think of it this way, its just a bonus for playing our game. We really hope you still enjoy playing League of Legends (those 50 minute super close games are the best IMO). But now when you win you have a chance of getting a little cherry on top! It's literally free stuff that you're getting now that you weren't getting before. Hextech crafting isn't there to make people who don't enjoy playing LoL play LoL. It's there for our awesome community to once in a while receive a small bonus for enjoying our game.
Upvoted because so true. Anytime we get a chest or a key it's a free bonus we never had before.

Hey,

2 quick questions.

1) So if I was in a premade with friends and someone got an S rank on wukong for example, would I still be able to get a chest from an S rank on wukong for the rest season?
2) Is it possible to obtain a key or just key fragments? as I've seen both answers

Thanks

Even if they get an S on Wukong, the chest binds to the champion you are playing. So that means you can't get a chest on whoever you were playing in that game for the rest of the season, you can however still get one yourself on Wukong ^^

1) You earn a chest for the champion YOU were playing. You then cant earn a chest for the champion YOU were on until next season.

2) Not sure where you have seen the other answers but on the support site it says - "Keys have a chance to drop in fragments after victories. Three fragments forge into a single key. Like chests, you can purchase them in the store."

Another question I just thought of
Is it possible to get legacy skins or retired skins in Hextech boxes?

Legacy yes, Limited no.

This means skins like Traditional Karma/Sej/Trundle are available, since they are only retired, but skins like Championship Riven, Black Alistar, Judgement Kayle etc are not because they were limited availability skins.
Heres a list - https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752944#h2

Hey riot :)

Just a quick question, why did you decide to make it so we can only get 4 chests every month and one chest on one champion per season? why dont we have unlimited chests ect? or maybe 4 chests  a week and not a month? would this cause a problem in game? what are your thoughts?

Thanks :D

Given that it includes S ranks earned in your premade, it's actually quite easy to get the chests, if they made it infinite you'd be earning champions faster then you do with IP, and skins at near the same rate. That or you'd just have a zillion chests and no keys to open them. Business perspective aside, it wouldn't be very satisfying that way, nor would it really feel like you'd earned anything. 

If first win of the day was first win of the hour, it'd just be a less IP for short games instead of something more akin to a pleasant surprise.

Could the number be higher than 4? Probably. Could the keys have a higher drop rate? Sure. But these are the numbers Riot settled on because it gives us a fun satisfying system to play with that doesn't create a negative/addictive experience.
Fair enough! thanks for the reply :D

Hey!

First of all, I love the whole concept of Hextech crafting. Just have one quick question. 
On the thread it says you can earn keys by winning any match made game. Are you guaranteed to earn a key if you win or is it random? Basically, what's the drop rate for a key if you win a match made game. Also, is there a limit to how many keys you can earn per month (like there is for chests)? 

Thanks =)

Hey Bytez,

Earn keys as rewards for winning any matchmade games or by purchasing them at the store for 125 RP. Keys unlock chests through Hextech Crafting. You dont get them every win, so there is a drop chance. But the chance increases if you are in a premade!

I don't believe their are limits to Key drops.

I don't believe there* are limits to Key drops.

Believe? would you be able to confirm? I'm on a league bender this weekend and at first the keys were flowing, but after 5 fragments they've completed dried up, 11 wins and no bueno. it would certainly seem like I've hit some sort of "keys earned in 24/48hr" cap

Great response here by one of our Board volunteers - http://boards.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/miscellaneous/VvKiKumL-hextech-key-frags?comment=0000

When asked about specifics on key fragment drop rates, Wingfield explained they key drop rates are not linear and the rates reset each month:
"Hey all,
Just want to help clarify some things about key drop rates:
Key drop rates are NOT linear and only wins have a chance of dropping a key. So you will earn key fragments much faster in your earlier wins than you will in your later wins. Or said another way, each incremental key fragment drop is harder than the last (on average... there is variance). This resets on a monthly basis for each player individually.
The goal is to create a nice ebb and flow.
Grade does NOT impact key drop chance.
Premades DO increase drop chance.
Hope that helps clarify "

Source found in the link.

So let me explain keys and chests clearer for you.

Keys - Keys, perhaps unsurprisingly, open chests. **Key fragments will sometimes drop after victory in any matchmade game mode**--unlike chests, you can earn keys in ARAM or Twisted Treeline. **Three key fragments can be forged into a single key**; you can also purchase keys through the store for RP. **Key fragments drop a little more frequently when you play with friends!**

Chests - This is a bit more complicated so please check this out, https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/207884233-Hextech-Crafting-Guide ,for full details but here is the summary

* You get a chest when you OR someone in your premade group gets S (S-, S or S+) Mastery at the end of a game.
* You are only allowed one chest per champion per season. e.g. if you are playing as Lucian and you or your premade friend gets an S mastery rank at the end of the game you will get a chest. BUT that means you can no longer earn a chest that season while playing Lucian.

Does that clear it up for you?

Is there somewhere that sort of highlights the requirements for mastery ratings?
I know if takes into account a number of things but just played a game where someone got an s- by basically afk farming the whole game and nearly causing us to lose while mid went 12-4-12 and completely carried with huge cs too but got an a-...

It's based on performance on that champion in that position. So if you pick someone like say Aurelion support you can get an S with a score of 6/6/13 which wouldn't get you an S in mid.

Basically it means that off meta picks or hard to play picks will get you an S with a much lower score. I say score because it isn't just your KDA but a whole bunch of other things as well.

Really the easiest way to highlight those requirements is to know the champion stats. If you know what the average KDA/cs etc for a champ in a position is then getting decently above that will pretty much reward you with an S. To give a little perspective, S+ is the top 2% of players on that champ in that position.
